item.title: PJCS LOGO
item.description:
,

Welcome to Phillip Johnson Computer Services, Shetland.

,

If you have hit a brick wall with your personal computer system and do not know where to turn, PJCS is your next stop.

item.title: Pricing / Live Chat
item.description:
Pricing / Live Chat

,

Thank you for your interest with PJCS. Prices are as follows:

,

Consultation: £25 per hour.

,

Datarecovery: £15 per 50Gb of data.

,

Hardware upgrades: £25 per hour plus parts.

,

General labour: £25 per hour.

,

Home visiting consultancy service is available in Shetland.

,

Consultations can be booked in 30 minute slots. This means that the minimum cost of a consultation is £12.50.

,

Other services offered here include:

,

Fractal graphics rendering and animation.

,

Photo editing.

,

Affordable, semi professional photography.

,

3D logo design, graphics and animation.

,

Replace missing rubber feet on your devices and units.

,

Sound effects, music and foley.

,

If you have any questions at all, you can find me here.

,,

item.title: Becoming a Developer on Google Play - Tips, Tricks, Things You Need!
item.description:
Becoming a Developer on Google Play - Tips, Tricks, Things You Need!

,

I recently became a developer on Google Play because I want to sell my games. Now, although my games are far from complete, they offer a glimpse of what could be possible in the future as I continue developing. Read on to learn about my experience so far and some tips for any aspiring developers who know what to expect.

item.title: My experience with BT complaints department, using internet in Shetland.
item.description:
My experience with BT complaints department, using internet in Shetland.

,

When you have only 1 choice of ISP and they know it, getting them to do anything for you or treat you fairly can be incredibly difficult.

item.title: Laptop Cleaning
item.description:
Cleaning My Laptop

,

So far the acrylic polish has worked well to give an excellent high gloss finish, restoring the lid of my laptop to almost new.
All that remains is to work out the scuffs and scratches, which I will use a wet sanding technique to do before applying more coats of acrylic polish.

,
